page.title: 02Agriculture in Exbourne
page.content: In the last twenty years farms have become bigger.Lots of hedges and trees have been taken out.Farms have become more industrialized.Cows and sheep are the most common farm animals.There are fewer cows now because of the Milk Quotas.Most of the fields are seeded pasture for grazing,silage or hay.Some corn is grown.Our survey showed that nowadays only two or three people work on each farm,although the farms are the same size or slightly larger. Farms, which up to the second World War employed up to a dozen men, are now farmed by the owner, his wife and usually a son or relation. This area has been farmed since Saxon times.We think it will continue to be farmed.The Common Market has affected farming in this area and will change it as the Policies alter and farmers follow suit.
